column4: Gaaah... DMA on makes my DVD playback very very laggy, DMA off makes it... just annoyingly laggy :(
And I don't have a slow system
gah-ness

yeah video playback for me last month when I first installed Ubuntu to check it out lagged too, and I compiled xine from scratch, custome compiled the kernel and killed almost all of the serivces so the box would be running pretty clean and I still had problems
didn't think about the DMA though hmm
if I'm copying files from CD, the same thing happens, my system goes unstable until it's done
ahhh okay
I've been surfing distrowatch for the last hour thinking to install another distro, after 5 years in Slack, I'm getting a bit tired and out of time for compiling all the time, LOL
lol
I just fixed the problem!!!
I just turned Multi mode DMA2 or something on, and it runs smooth now
what did you do?
how?
sudo hdparm -d1 -X34 /dev/cdrom
hmm I thought we are more concerned for DMA on the hdd not a cdrom
well my CD/DVD drive was the problem here, and that fixed it :)
well for me I was playing a movie off the hdd
maybe I can run something like that on the hdd then
maybe
you gonna be around for awhile?
